comments.body: This is probably not the right type. I need to pass `{scroll: '30s'}` (thirty seconds), it's a valid param for elasticsearch, but forbidden by the type

According to the documentation (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/javascript-api/current/api-reference.html#api-scroll) `scroll` is a Date or a number.  In version 2.3 the type was `Duration` (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/javascript-api/current/api-reference-2-3.html#api-scroll-2-3).

If you're using version 5.0 and can confirm that Duration is still acceptable despite what the documentation says then I'm happy putting it back.

If you're using version 2.3 or something like that then the file should be copied to `index-{version}` as per http://definitelytyped.org/guides/contributing.html and the change done in there.
Can you link to that?  Can you test it on your instance?  Clearly the doc is inconsistent then and the question is just which part is correct.
I'll track that down.  Certainly there's an issue for the Elasticsearch project here.

I submitted a bug report for the documentation.  https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch-js/issues/467 (edit: changed issue link).  We can update the typing based on what the fix for their documentation is.
